site_name: Taxi House, 11 Woodfield Road, London, W9 2BA
description: This Council is asked for its observations on an application submitted to Westminster City Council for: Variation of Condition 1 (approved plans and documents) of planning permission dated 3 July 2020 (RN: 19/04487/FULL) for: Demolition of existing buildings and structures and construction of a new mixed-use development comprising hotel and associated facilities (Class C1), flexible workspace (Class B1a / B1c), retail and food and beverage (Class A1 / A3), events space (Sui Generis) and a replacement street cleaning depot (Sui Generis) with associated new public realm and highways improvements. (site includes Taxi House, Waterside House and Westminster Street Sweepers Depot). Namely, internal design changes to the lower amenity levels and the addition of a new floor level positioned between the previous level 03 and level 04, variation of building heights, increase in hotel rooms from 286 to 332 with the maximum number of storeys increasing from 11 to 12, yet as mentioned above the proposed amendments will still sit within the maximum building height of +69.350 AOD. All design changes and corresponding minor amendments to design strategies are described in the following chapters of this addendum Any items that have not been described remain unchanged from the Approved Scheme.
